title: The Resurrection and Commission
shortSummary: Mark 16 recounts the resurrection of Jesus Christ, His appearances to His followers, and the Great Commission to spread the gospel to all nations. This chapter affirms the victory of Christ over death and the foundation of Christian mission and faith.
timeline: c. AD 30-33 - Resurrection of Jesus Christ

keyCharacters.name: Mary Magdalene
keyCharacters.description: A devoted follower of Jesus who witnessed His resurrection and was the first to proclaim the news to the disciples.

keyCharacters.name: Mary the mother of James
keyCharacters.description: One of the women who came to anoint Jesus’ body and encountered the empty tomb.

keyCharacters.name: Salome
keyCharacters.description: Another woman who came with the others to the tomb and witnessed the resurrection message.

keyCharacters.name: The young man in white
keyCharacters.description: An angelic figure at the tomb who announced Jesus’ resurrection to the women.

keyCharacters.name: The eleven disciples
keyCharacters.description: The remaining apostles who received Jesus’ final instructions and witnessed His ascension.

definitions.definition: A tomb or burial place; in this chapter, the tomb where Jesus was laid after His crucifixion.
To apply oil or spices to a body, often as part of burial customs to honor the dead.
A Christian sacrament of initiation involving water symbolizing purification and admission into the faith.
The act of Jesus rising bodily into heaven after His resurrection.

outline.heading: The Women Visit the Tomb
outline.description: After the Sabbath, Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James, and Salome bring spices to anoint Jesus’ body but find the stone rolled away and the tomb empty, encountering a young man in white who announces His resurrection.

outline.heading: The Resurrection Announced
outline.description: The angel tells the women not to fear and that Jesus has risen, instructing them to inform the disciples, but they flee in fear and amazement without initially sharing the news.

outline.heading: Jesus Appears to His Followers
outline.description: Jesus first appears to Mary Magdalene, then to two disciples, and finally to the eleven apostles, rebuking them for unbelief and hardness of heart despite the eyewitness testimonies.

outline.heading: The Great Commission
outline.description: Jesus commands His disciples to preach the gospel to all creation, promising salvation to believers and signs that will accompany them, including miracles and protection.

outline.heading: The Ascension and Ongoing Mission
outline.description: Jesus ascends into heaven and sits at God’s right hand, while the disciples go forth preaching everywhere with the Lord confirming their message through accompanying signs.

application: Trust in the power of the resurrection as the foundation of your faith and hope in Christ’s victory over death.
Obey Jesus’ command to share the gospel boldly, knowing He equips and protects His followers.
Overcome doubt by remembering the eyewitness testimonies and Jesus’ patient restoration of the disciples’ faith.
Live with confidence in the presence and power of the risen Lord who intercedes for believers and empowers their mission.

keyVerses.text: And he saith unto them, Be not affrighted: Ye seek Jesus of Nazareth, which was crucified: he is risen; he is not here: behold the place where they laid him.
keyVerses.significance: This verse proclaims the core truth of Christianity—the resurrection of Jesus, defeating death and confirming His divine identity.

keyVerses.text: And he said unto them, Go ye into all the world, and preach the gospel to every creature.
keyVerses.significance: This is the Great Commission, the foundational mandate for Christian evangelism and mission.

keyVerses.text: He that believeth and is baptized shall be saved; but he that believeth not shall be damned.
keyVerses.significance: This verse emphasizes the necessity of faith and baptism for salvation, highlighting the urgency of responding to the gospel.

keyVerses.text: So then after the Lord had spoken unto them, he was received up into heaven, and sat on the right hand of God.
keyVerses.significance: This verse confirms Jesus’ exaltation and authority, assuring believers of His ongoing reign and intercession.
